Definition: In this task, you are given a text and a title. The title is present in the text, and it refers to the entity mentioned in the text. The title might be slightly different from what is present in the text, but if it still refers to the same entity, then it is a correct title. Indicate your answer as "Yes" if the title is correct, otherwise indicate your answer as "No".

Positive Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Positive Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, it is the title of the document.

Positive Examples.input:
Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll. 
Title: HMS Argyll (F231)
Positive Examples.explanation: "HMS Argyll" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Here, the text in parentheses "F31" is not present in the document and it can be ignored. Hence, the output is correct.

Negative Examples.input:
Text: The Mansfield Building Society is a UK building society which has its headquarters in Mansfield Nottinghamshire. It is a member of the Building Societies Association. 
Title: Mansfield Building Society
Negative Examples.explanation: The title "Mansfield Building Society" is present in the text and it is the main entity that is referred in the text. Hence, the output is incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:

Negative Examples.explanation: The output should be either "Yes" or "No". Hence, it is negative example.

Instances.input:
Text:  Another Journal Entry is the second studio album released by the Christian pop/rock group BarlowGirl. The album was released on September 27 2005. Three of the songs are not original to this album; Enough is a Chris Tomlin work No One Like You is a cover of the David Crowder Band version and Not Alone is a different mix of their debut-album hit.An expanded edition was released in late August 2006. 
Title: Another Journal Entry

Text:  Składów [ˈskwaduf] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Baranów within Puławy County Lublin Voivodeship in eastern Poland. It lies approximately 6 kilometres (4 mi) north-east of Baranów 25 km (16 mi) north-east of Puławy and 46 km (29 mi) north-west of the regional capital Lublin.The village has a population of 80. 
Title: My Life as a Traitor

Text:  Jamie Lewis (born February 26 1977) a.ka. Nebula is an American musician filmmaker comedian and entrepreneur. His career spans two decades in the entertainment and recording industry. 
Title: Kani Pankeh Qajer

Text:  Acrocercops cymella is a moth of the Gracillariidae family known from Puerto Rico. It was described by W.T.M. Forbes in 1931. 
Title: Acrocercops cymella

Text:  Child & Co. is a formerly independent private bank that is now owned by The Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS). The branch is based at 1 Fleet Street in the City of London. It is authorised as a brand of The Royal Bank of Scotland by the Prudential Regulation Authority. 
Title: Child & Co.

Text:  Basil Abdullah Ahmed Al-Rawahi commonly known as Basil Al-Rawahi (Arabic: باسل عبدالله أحمد الرواحي‎) is an Omani footballer who plays for Fanja SC. 
Title: Xastilia

Text:  Bear Mountain Indian Mission School is a historic Native American missionary school in Amherst Virginia.The school was used by the Monacan tribe since: [i]n 1868 [when] a parcel of land was donated for a meeting place for the Indian people. At the time churches and schools were provided for whites and for blacks but not for Indians. Originally a wooden arbor served as the meeting place and itinerant ministers began to hold Baptist and Methodist services there. 
Title: Bear Mountain Indian Mission School

Text:  The Calvert Mill/Washington Mill also known as the Old Mill is an historic mill located on Old Mill Road in Washington Virginia. Its water source is the Rush River. The Calvert name comes from George Calvert Jr. a local landowner who owned it from 1779 to 1800. The oldest part of the present mill dates from this period. Later additions were made in 1840 and 1860. It was bought in 1979 by Peter Kramer who planned to restore it. 
Title: USS Aroostook (CM-3)
